settings.below_hero_heading: Ethically made by empowered artisans in Kenya

settings.favorite: Hands down our people. We have truly created something beautiful together.
The incredible friendships I've made (both stateside and around the world), the focus on empowering working moms, and the opportunity to be a part of something so much bigger than myself.

settings.leadership_position: Head of Market Research and Sales
settings.favorite: our work culture, the friendships I’ve created with coworkers, and that I get to be a small part of empowering other humans to become their best version of themselves!
The artisans, our entire team, and the friendship created (both in Kenya and state side).
The love, passion, zeal and commitment within the entire workforce working together and making a difference.
The chance to experience multiple cultures.

settings.latest_obsesstion: Choco puff cereals+ greys anatomy tv show.
settings.favorite: The culture,work ethics and how everyone is sold out in what they do.
Imani gives one an opportunity to grow.

settings.leadership_position: Production Assitant + Head of Screen Printing
settings.favorite: The love of the Imani team, the care  and they help the workers to grow on what they do at Imani.
Brings about a turquoise aura effect amidst the diversity.
The people, diverse culture, love, zeal, energy, and the opportunity to be in a space where you can make mistakes, learn, and grow.
Relationships created among the artisans and staff.
The community and purpose we work towards everyday.

settings.heading_text: our leadership spans globally across the US and Kenya

settings.banner_text: Passionately pursuing a holistic approach to empowerment, we are convinced that we aren’t just better together — we’re our best together.

settings.main_heading: Together, we unleash greatness within artisans + their communities by crafting ethical lifestyle products that cultivate holistic empowerment and opportunity
settings.content_text:
Sixteen women looking for a better way to provide for their families. Sixteen women who believed they were worth more than the saturated fruit selling street markets. Sixteen women intrigued enough by Jenny’s vision to stick by her side and grow together.

Imani Collective started in a small village outside of Mombasa, Kenya. Our founder, Jenny Nuccio, traveled there looking to help fund education projects for kids. As she got to know the families she realized that the children who were struggling the most came from single income homes where their mother’s did not have many job opportunities and often sold fruit for mere pennies a day. Jenny fell in love with the people and decided to move to Kenya full time to learn from and invest in the community. Through broken English and Swahili, she and the sixteen women awkwardly laughed their way into deep friendship and mutual partnership. They taught her how to cook over an open fire, how to wash her clothes, and of course, how to carry her water like a local. In return, Jenny taught them how to sew. Through creating this collective, she realized they were not just better together, they are their best together.

settings.banner_text:
"Trust me," she said.
"We’re going to build something beautiful."
And they did.

settings.content_text: Imani Collective now employs over eighty Kenyan women + men in Mtepeni Village and Mombasa, along with half a dozen women stateside. Together, we unleash a woman’s greatness through empowerment + opportunity + community.

settings.main_heading: Our leadership spans globally across the US and Kenya.

settings.sub_heading: See the different ways you can get involved with Imani Collective

settings.content_text: Dignified employment is a key ingredient for economic development and poverty alleviation in developing countries around the world. Over the past 5 years, Imani Collective’s innovative model for providing women, men and their families with consistent wages, skills training, community and access to education has proven highly successful at improving artisan livelihoods and well-being.

settings.number_content_text_1: Approximately 46% of Kenyans live below the international poverty line of $1.90 per day, as defined by the World Bank.
settings.number_content_text_2: Imani Collective pays more than 2.6 times more than minimum wage along with unmatched benefits.
settings.number_content_text_3: Of our artisans reported that they are satisfied with their income this year. We provide our artisans with fair, steady wages that honor the time and skill that go into making each and every product by hand, with heart.
settings.number_content_text_4: Of our artisans reported that they have a secure way to provide for their family. We recognize that in order to empower women, we must also empower their families. Our artisans’ access to a consistent source of income, as well as child education tuition sponsorships, emergency medical funding, in-house child enrichment program and financial literacy training, have enabled our women to invest in their skills and provide opportunities for their children to advance.

settings.content_text_1: We are continually inspired by the beauty of traditional African artisanship and look forward to elevating our artisans’ craft and showcasing Imani’s unique aesthetic each and every year. We have developed a diverse yet cohesive product line that not only spans five years of artisan craft and modern design, but also holds increasingly competitive value in the marketplace!
settings.content_text_2:
We strive to be ethically-responsible and environmentally-friendly when sourcing our local, raw + organic materials. By sourcing from local markets + vendors we are investing in the local economy which is essential to overall economic development in the area.

We support the integrity of ethically sourced, artisan made goods and create opportunities for men and women to make them.
settings.content_text_3: Wool, organic dye, cotton, leather, felt, stuffing, clay.

settings.content_text: We want to see our artisan made goods in your beautiful homes + spaces. We want to share our heart with you + watch you share it with the world. You don’t need to have thousands of followers to apply. We just want to spread some Imani Collective goodness!

settings.main_heading: check out our brand ambassadors sharing our story
settings.bottom_text: Enter your email below to receive an application when they go live!

settings.main_heading: Want to experience working with an ethical brand?
settings.content_text:
Whether you're looking to hone in on your design skills, learn more about marketing strategy, or spend time in Kenya seeing our ethical manufacturing firsthand, we have the place for you to learn and make an impact.

Opportunities are available in SLC, Utah, Dallas, Texas and Mombasa, Kenya.

"Trust me," she said.
"We’re going to build something beautiful."
And they did.

settings.sub_heading_1: Full Time Remote Position - Requires Travel
settings.left_col_text_1:
- Advance the mission and goals of the nonprofit alongside the Founder

- Create strategy to strengthen the financials of the nonprofit

- Develop annual plans and budgets in all areas

- Create and execute fundraising plans
settings.right_col_text_1:
- Provide leadership to constituent relations programs

- Ensure dynamic processes in all phases of donor qualifications

-Work closely with Founder in all phases of advancement and campaign leadership activities

Questions about this position? Please email partnerships @imanicollective.com
settings.left_col_text_2:
- Work directly with our artisans

- Help source materials for products

- Assist with growing our holistic programs

- Communicate with both Kenya and US teams
settings.right_col_text_2:
- Credit towards Institution Requirements

- Experiencing another culture

- Experience working in the ethical manufacturing industry

- Letter of recommendation

- Resume Building with work experience

- Discounts on Imani products

settings.content_text: We are always looking for help in our markets and various events throughout the year. If you are in the Dallas area or know of a market or event you would like to represent us in, let us know!
settings.box_heading: Tell us a little about yourself and our team will get back to you as soon as possible.

settings.box_text: With Imani, a give back partnership is about impact and awareness. Together, we will work to create impact that is meaningful for your company, employees, customers and our local + global communities.
settings.second_text: A give back partnership is a mutually beneficial commitment between a business and a non-profit organization. The business gives a portion of their profit to support a cause they believe in and in return, the business gains marketing exposure and a positive reputation. It is a unique way for you to use your business to make the world a better place by working with us to end the generational cycles of poverty. The partnership creates a way for your business to be socially responsible and become part of the solution.
settings.third_heading: What are the Benefits For You?
settings.third_content:
As a give back partner with Imani, you are clearly and boldly communicating to your staff and clientele that you care about leveraging your business to make a difference in the world. You proactively use your brand to raise awareness and inspire your community to be engaged.

You become part of a movement that is creating a high impact, and transforming lives globally.

As a Give Back Partner with Imani Collective, we celebrate your commitment to changemaking. We will recognize your efforts by consistently featuring you + your company in electronic and print materials we send to our community so that they can know you and support your business.

settings.content_text:
Imani Collective is a community of dreamers + shakers who aren’t afraid to ask, “why not?” Daily, we passionately pursue a holistic approach to empowerment because we believe that once we realize what we’re made of, we can own what we’re made for.

So why us? We are in the business of loving well and transforming lives through economic stability, job security, education and training. Together, we empower women, break the generational cycle of poverty, create opportunity, and change futures.

We believe we aren’t just better together, we are our best together.
settings.content_text_alt: We believe we will be our very best with you.

settings.list_text:
Skills Training

Child Enrichment Program

Daily Nutritious meals

Personal Budgeting Assistance

Business Training Seminars

RISE: personal development courses

Medical Emergency Fund

Dream Management

Education Scholarships for our Artisans’ Children
settings.box_text: Many partners choose to give between 10-20% of their monthly profit. Other business owners choose to give a set amount per transaction. This is a personal decision and whatever ‘give back’ you choose, we are grateful for your partnership.

settings.main_heading: want to go visit our artisans in Kenya?
settings.content_text: Join us in immersing ourselves in the new: new culture, new friendships, new food, new conversations. We will spend time at both Imani workshops in Old Town + Mtepeni - where you will have the opportunity to learn + explore what is happening in the "boots on the ground" operations of Imani Collective. You will serve a key role in assisting us to strengthen, improve + grow our holistic programs, and continue to advocate for us globally. Your Imani Experience will be tailored specifically to your team based on the experience, passions + skills you possess individually + collectively.

settings.main_heading: JOIN US AT AN UPCOMING EVENT!

settings.content_text: We believe that women and their children hold the key to this social change. We know that when women rise in the economy, the whole country rises. So, we invest in generations of women because we have confidence in their ability to achieve (and exceed) their goals. We believe that women around the globe have the capacity, creativity, and determination to uplift themselves, their families, and their communities—all they need are the resources. We unleash a women’s greatness through empowerment, opportunity + community.
